name: gregariousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of enjoying the company of other people: He has inherited much of his father's gregariousness and easy-going nature. For all her warmth and gregariousness , there was something remote and unreachable about her.
biology
  specialized (especially of animals) the habit of living together in groups: The birds' successful worldwide expansion is attributed to their gregariousness. Gregariousness is essential to the survival of certain animal species. See
gregarious
More examplesFewer examplesHe never allowed his ill-health to limit his gregariousness with his many devoted friends.a country legendary for the gregariousness of its people and their gentle dispositionFemale seals are forced to clump together, a tendency sometimes called gregariousness.
